title: What is learning a scientific approach? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is learning a scientific approach? Learning the scientific approach is the learning process designed so that learners are actively mengonstruk concept, law or principle through the stages observed (to identify or find the problem), formulate problems, propose or formulate hypotheses, collect data with a variety of techniques, analyzing the data. scientific method consisting of systematic observation, measurement, and experiment, and the formulation, testing, and modification of hypotheses.

I would condense the “scientific approach” into the genius to frame the right questions to coax genuinely fruitful answers out of a taciturn subject. What would the orbital motions of the planets look like if the Sun, rather than the earth, were the centre of all astronomical rotation? (Copernicus). Do balls of different mass fall faster than each other from the Leaning Tower of Pisa? - Aristotle thought so, but he didn’t ask Nature if it were so. (Galileo Galilei). Odd to extrapolate from this and think: perhaps there are a few discrete questions to ask of Reality that might actually bring the roof down. Unlike the best Metaphysics we’ve come up with - the answer 42. (Douglas Adams).

Basic increments of one view of the scientific method are: 1) make an observation that describes a problem. 2) create a hypothesis. 3) test the hypothesis. 4) make inferences or conclusions and refine the hypothesis accordingly.
